TopicTitle: [1.5.x] Asclepius - A Kopernicus planet - SSTO playground

Articles.Content:
Version 1.5

[https://github.com/MrChumley/Asclepius/releases](https://github.com/MrChumley/Asclepius/releases)

You might want to try a clean install of ksp with just the Asclepeius and Kopernicus mods and see if that works.

Having said that, although I have gotten it to work, ksp v1.1.2 is crashing regularly when I have these 2 mods installed so there appears to be other issues with these mods and ksp.

[@MrChumley](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/58555-mrchumley/) how would you suggest I run this mod in KSP v1.1.2 with Kopernicus v2:release-1-0-3? (The Kopernicus version is what I read off the CKAN metadata screen, though [its forum thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/103277-112-kopernicus-103-april-20/) just indicates v1.0.3.)  I see chatter above this comment discussing running modified .cfg's, but I've been having trouble with this.  

If CKAN is the issue, I can happily install it manually.  Thanks!

> 
> 
> On 6/30/2015 at 0:10 PM, Hades said:
> 
> 
> I tried out your mod and made [some pictures](http://imgur.com/a/sqUP2).
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I liked the general appearance of landscape, the "rivers" or "cracks", and the fact that the atmosphere is only dense low makes you fly around in them, which I found enjoyable. It's like flying around in that only river on Kerbin, only there's more.
> 

Yes I Like Them Those Pictures Are Very Nice.
Can you make a version for ksp 1.1.3 because i really want to land there :D!
It will probably just work. Seemed to in KSP 1.1.2 with its versions of Kopernicus at least. (Kopernicus on KSP 1.1.3 has a bug with other planet mods that move Kerbin, so I haven't upgraded myself).

\*mad scientist voice\*

They told me: Bash! Don't fly above Asclepius' dunes, you'll die! But I showed them! I showed them all! Muahhaha.

![M27n6](http://imgur.com/a/M27n6)

No but seriously, I have no idea how I managed to actually fly over the 10000 kilometre mark. And by the way, those engines are the KAX electric motors. Same as normal engines, except it requires electricity to run instead of fuel. And I somehow managed to get a suborbital trajectory. I think it's mainly due to the low gravity, light design and big wings. There was so little atmosphere, I was getting speeds of 800 m/s

I had to use a ramp to get enough lift to get off the ground though XD

Love the planet, it's cracks and rivers look amazing! I'm working on a huge exploration mission, including ISRU and colonisation. I play New Horizons and put Asclepius in a binary relation with Laythe, for no other reason than because it looks awesome. 

**Edited <time datetime="2016-08-08T03:57:29Z" title="08/08/2016 03:57  AM" data-short="7 yr">August 8, 2016</time> by BashGordon33**
Ive been away from KSP a while and came back hoping to add this planet - does it work for 1.2.1?
here to ask the same question

Hey Fellow Kerbonaughts!

I think an Asclepius update is long overdue.

I have updated it for KSP 1.3  It should work on the older 1.2 version as well.

My apologies for taking so long.

**[DOWNLOAD AsclepiusV1-3.zip from GitHub](https://github.com/MrChumley/Asclepius/releases/download/v1.3/AsclepiusV1-3.zip)**
OMFG yes! Much thanks, asclepius is like my fav planet ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I'm going to need more info if you need help.  Or was that an accidental post?

On a different note, I got <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> to work, and have been trying a few things... I think I have settled on a low haze that floats just above the dense air.  Any thoughts?

**Edited <time datetime="2017-07-25T13:18:09Z" title="07/25/2017 01:18  PM" data-short="6 yr">July 25, 2017</time> by Gordon Dry**
Yea lazy crossposts without explanation will usually get ignored.

UPDATE

Asclepius v3.0 has been released!

![cQ12JCh.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/cQ12JCh.jpg)

[Download AsclepiusV3-0.zip](https://github.com/MrChumley/Kronkus/releases/download/V1.3.3/KronkusV1-3-3.zip)

Features terrain updates for the new kopernicus v1.3.0-5, and configs added for the new <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> 1.2.2-1 (clouds,and eclipse shadows)

Enjoy ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
Nice Planet

Ahoy kerbonauts!  Just a small update:

AsclepiusV3 can now be installed via [<abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/154922-ckan-the-comprehensive-kerbal-archive-network-v1223-mahia/). ![:science:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/science.png ":science:")

Add [ContractConfigurator-FarOutContracts](https://github.com/MrChumley/FarOut/releases) too for custom contracts offered in career mode!

\*contract pack requires [Contract Configurator](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/91625-130-contract-configurator-v1232-2017-08-03/)

![qsLImBr.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/qsLImBr.jpg)

Enjoy

Thanks [@GDJ](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/58462-gdj/) ! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

In other new news FarOut contract pack not only adds custom contracts, but now with the help of Kerbal Konstructs and Kerbinside assets, also adds several bases scattered around Asclepius that you can launch your ships from. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr> for D/L links)

Thank you for being awesome!

**Edited <time datetime="2017-10-03T04:51:50Z" title="10/03/2017 04:51  AM" data-short="6 yr">October 3, 2017</time> by MrChumley**

Hi [@MrChumley](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/58555-mrchumley/),

There are two old Asclepius-related packages in <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> that have not been updating correctly for a while.

[http://status.ksp-<abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr>.org/](http://status.ksp-ckan.org/)

| NetKAN | Last Checked | Last Inflated | Last Indexed | Last Error |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Asclepius-clouds | 6 hours ago | 6 hours ago | 2 years ago | Could not find BoulderCo entry in zipfile to install |
| ContractConfigurator-Asclepius | 6 hours ago | 6 hours ago | 2 years ago | Could not find ContractPacks entry in zipfile to install |

Both are looking for directories that are no longer in the main download, in one case BoulderCo, and in the other ContractPacks.

Are these still needed?

@HebaruSan

No they are no longer needed for the current install.

Asclepius now only contains a config for <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> clouds, and the contracts have been moved into FarOut contract pack.

Thanks for letting me know.  I'll try and get it straightened out.

\*edit\* I see that you are on the case..  Its cool if they are removed.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-10-05T03:00:54Z" title="10/05/2017 03:00  AM" data-short="6 yr">October 5, 2017</time> by MrChumley**
  
Hebaru is awesome

It's back? Wow, I've missed this mod. It was the first planet I visited beyond Kerbin, so I'm glad to see it's updated once again. I wonder if there's a nice niche for it in the New Horizons system (I might play around with orbit locations).

EDIT: I just spotted the compatibility note on the original post in this thread about New Horizons. Quite a coincidence; I was going to put it near Laythe too if it didn't fit in the system nicely (probably 60 degrees behind in the same orbit).

I extracted the files and re-zipped them and it worked fine.
